abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the objectives for the
            investment component were achieved and it was rated
            satisfactory throughout its life, despite the
            socio-political instability and civil strife in the country
            which endangered implementation. However, the achievement of
            the objectives for the forestry sector adjustment program
            fell short of expectations, although the Bank and the
            government did agree on a forestry audit that provided
            useful information for future sustained policy action.
            IDA's performance is rated satisfactory for project
            identification and preparation, and for supervision of the
            investment component. The borrower's performance is
            rated satisfactory for implementing the investment
            component, and rated unsatisfactory for policy reform
            implementation and institutional development. Key lessons
            learned included: 1) Appropriate policy and institutional
            reforms should strongly focus on sector work in advance of
            appraisal. 2) the borrower's capacity to absorb reforms
            should be estimated more carefully at appraisal. 3)
            Implementation of timetables should be more realistic and
            adapted to sector constraints. 4) Complex projects should
            use Bank experts to supervise policy reforms. 5) In
            designing forestry and biodiversity conservation programs,
            more attention should be paid to local constraints and
            policy distortions underlying natural resource degradation
            and forest depletion. 6) Forestry development and
            biodiversity conservation recurrent costs should not come
            solely from the government.
